title: How to read books online without paying means free of cost? Is there any best app or site - Quora

response.answer_text: I just answered a pretty similar question haha. But most major libraries have what’s known as an online library, where you can essentially check out books through your either your phone or computer (or whatever other device you happen to use) for free using your library card. But since there’s so many of them, they usually have kinda quirky names, so you might want to ask someone that works at your local library if they have an online library (again if it’s a “major” library with like multiple branches, chances are that they will) and how you can access it.

The best app I know is Wattpad. Free reading offline and online anywhere. Advantages: You can write too! Publish a book of your own, gain followers, follow authors you love, vote for their works, achieve rankings and win awards.
Project Gutenberg gives you free access to 55,000+ ebooks.
Try early bird books if not then it's better to go to the library and get a library card
